channel.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
channel.description: Can someone tell me how I can add a custom NPC to a server? And how to edit he's HP and position etc.

item.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42
item.description:
@Darkmagic42 wrote:

u can change his maxhit and i think but am not sure att style in npchandler.java, u can change his hp in npc.cfg and if u wanna change combat level u can change that in the ints

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?

item.description:
@Eyfia wrote:

~*icestorm*~:

Try using a npc id that is a npc already in rs but you don’t use

Nevermind, now it works… Where can I add how strong it is and attack style? Also when i fight him, he don’t move.

item.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
item.dc:creator: @Eyfia Eyfia
item.description:
@Eyfia wrote:

Darkmagic42:

yes, all u gotta change is the [3] to [1]

Okey, how can i choose good IP for my NPC? Because when i try some few, in game i don’t spawn my NPC but some other NPC’s who are somewhere in RuneScape, like- I tried 12550 but it spawned me a random man.

item.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
item.dc:creator: @Eyfia Eyfia
item.description:
@Eyfia wrote:

[quote=“Darkmagic42, post:6, topic:356978”] class5.anIntArray94 = new int[3]; // Number of models the NPC uses
class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10013; //
class5.anIntArray94[1] = 10128; //
class5.anIntArray94[2] = 10186; //[/quote]

But if my model uses only one model should I do this?:

class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses
class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10013; //

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?

item.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42
item.description:
@Darkmagic42 wrote:

}
if (i == 72) { // NPC ID
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630];
class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data
class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
class5.aStringArray66[1] = “Attack”;
class5.anIntArray94 = new int[3]; // Number of models the NPC uses
class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10013; //
class5.anIntArray94[1] = 10128; //
class5.anIntArray94[2] = 10186; //
class5.aString65 = “Mithril Dragon”; // NPC name
class5.anInt61 = 304; // combat level
class5.aByteArray89 = “A scary dragon made of mithril”.getBytes(); // NPC description

those r ints, u gotta take the ints for ur npc and just put em under the rest of those.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?

item.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
item.dc:creator: @Eyfia Eyfia
item.description:
@Eyfia wrote:

[quote=“Darkmagic42, post:4, topic:356978”]as he said u gotta add the ints in class5.java and place models in model folder, to spawn u gotta add it in autospawn and to add hp go to npc.cfg and add your new npc in there.

example:
npc = 9 Guard 21 22 10
21= combat level(u actually change this in the ints) 22= hp, 10= respawn time

hope this helps:)[/quote]

Thanks, but can you explain me something about ints in Class5.java?

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?

item.title: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42
item.description:
@Darkmagic42 wrote:

as he said u gotta add the ints in class5.java and place models in model folder, to spawn u gotta add it in autospawn and to add hp go to npc.cfg and add your new npc in there.

example:
npc = 9 Guard 21 22 10
21= combat level(u actually change this in the ints) 22= hp, 10= respawn time

hope this helps:)

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a custom NPC to a 317 server?
